error.signature: ERROR: Project file has a 'pyproject.toml' and its build backend is missing the 'build_editable' hook

verdict.summary: pip install -e . fails because build backend doesn't support editable installs.

dead_ends.why_fails: Loses live editing — need to reinstall after every change

dead_ends.action: Downgrade pip to bypass the check
dead_ends.why_fails: Old pip has other issues — better to fix the build config

workarounds.action: Add setuptools to build-system in pyproject.toml — it supports build_editable
Or use pip install -e . --no-build-isolation if using a custom backend
workarounds.how:
# Skip build isolation (uses current environment's build tools):
pip install -e . --no-build-isolation

# You may need to install build deps first:
pip install setuptools wheel
pip install -e . --no-build-isolation

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'ERROR' is a install_error error while 'ERROR' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
